data.title: Debug javascript angular-cli, breakpoints ignored
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.9.1
- OS Version: windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:

1. create angular-cli project with some components (e.g. https://github.com/doczoidberg/ang1)
2. install chrome debug extension and use it 1.9.1
ng serve
attach debugger in vs code

debugging console works in vs code so that I think chrome is attached to vs code right.

but when settings a breakpoint in app.component.ts line 9 vs code says 'Breakpoint ignored because generated code could not be found (source map problem?)

this problem does not occur in webstorm 2017. 
Breakpoints are sometimes also set on the wrong line in VS code

data.title: Instructions for debugging Code dev builds
data.body:
So I'm following the instructions in [How to Contribute](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/wiki/How-to-Contribute#build-and-run-from-source) and attempting to build and debug a dev version of VSCode, but there seems to be steps missing. I can't figure out if it's supposed to be like that or if I'm missing something.

I've successfully cloned, npm-installed, built and executed a dev version of Code and now I'm trying to get my stable (1.9.1) version to attach to the dev version.

The instructions say:

> Using VSCode
> 
> Install the Debugger for Chrome extension. This extension will let you attach to and debug client side code running in Chrome.
> Launch the development version of Code with the following command line option:
> OSX and Linux
> 
> ./scripts/code.sh --remote-debugging-port=9222
> Windows
> 
> scripts\code --remote-debugging-port=9222
> Choose the Attach to VSCode launch configuration from the launch dropdown in the Debug viewlet and press F5.
> 

But the Attach stage doesn't work. The first error is that the Debugger for Chrome extension requires a URL in the config - but there's no URL entry in the Attach config of `launch.json`.
So I guess a URL to add and I get a second error - this time telling me that it cannot connect and also helpfully providing me with a (very long!) `file:///` URL that I appear to need.
I replace the URL in launch.json with this new file URL and it still fails with the same error.

After reading the Debugger for Chrome page, I find that the URL entry supports wildcards - I add a `*` to the end of the URL and it successfully attaches.

Is this correct? Was I supposed to configure something else? Should it just work without the URL parameter? If not, could you update the docs.

data.title: Extensions tab hangs forever
data.body:
The extension tab hangs forever without showing any extensions (neither installed nor available in the marketplace). So I cannot install any extensions.

- VSCode Version: 1.9.1
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open Extensions tab
2. It hangs for ever

The same happens when I try to install an extension with CTRL+P > `ext install csharp`

I already tried to completely uninstall VS Code, delete the extensions directory, reboot, and then install it again, but that didn't help.
And since this seems to be a cause of similar issues: I am not behind a proxy.

data.title: [i18n] 'Select icon theme' in RU locale has ugly translation
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.9.1
- OS Version: Any

Menu item at 'File' -> 'Settings' -> 'Select icon theme' has unnatural translation "Тема значка файла".
It would be better look something like "Выбрать тему иконок" or "Тема иконок файлов".

data.title: [i18n] Fix ru locale
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.9.1
In the main menu, the russian translation looks ugly & does not correspond generally accepted standards.

En | ru locale now | ru locale fix 
------------ | ------------- | ------------ 
View|Просмотреть|Вид
Edit|Изменить|Правка
Go|Перейти|Переход
Selection|Выбор|Выделение

PS. Where you are translating?
Maybe it makes sense to use the special services, such as transifex.com, etc ?

data.title: [css] suggest class names that exist in other css files

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
VSCode is awesome mainly it's intelisense.
I would like to have option to get intelisense suggestion from another opened file.

Currently when working on any CSS or SCSS file. VSCode only suggests for the class name, if it is present in same file. 

Look at here, it is only suggesting class name that are already present there.
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2367137/23119187/462bdc66-f77f-11e6-93af-db11946cda4d.png)

It would be really helpful, if we could get suggestion from another opened file. When opened another HTML or CSS file, there should be suggestion coming from them.

This is visually edited. Here it is suggesting for class name that are present on another file.
![suggestion](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2367137/23119677/45236968-f781-11e6-841b-bba312db6c43.png)

Thank you
Kudos to VSCode Team

data.title: Go to File... preview of currently highlighted file in drawer
data.body:
Feature request: this is a helpful feature of Sublime Text currently missing in VS Code.

When the 'Go to File' tool drawer is open, preview the file that is currently highlighted in the drawer in the editor pane (or the pane that has focus, if using split editor) behind the file selection drawer.

Allows easy previewing and selection of correct file before opening; especially useful where files have similar names and / or paths.

data.title: File models get disposed when contents change on disk
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version:1.8.1
- OS Version:win10

Command "vscode.previewHtml" can only provide two ways to preview a Html resource.
The one is providing Url, but when the Html file changes, how to update the preview content? Is there some sample code?
The second is providing a virtual resource, but when I want to use some js files to render this Html, do I have to give the absolute path? If so, How can I do when js file reference to another js file(in this case, it have to be a relative path(?)).

data.title: Terminal: Parent Folder relative path formatting issue in terminal
data.body:
This is on Windows and I noticed it on Thursday or Friday. When using a relative parent folder path in the terminal it is causing weird spacing issues when moving the cursor. @Tyriar I wasn't sure if this was an issue in code or upstream

If the cursor is at the end of the line it forces the `..` to join the previous command in the prompt. I added a gif showing the behavior

- VSCode Version: 1.10.0-Insiders
- OS Version:  Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Type a command and then a relative parent path like the following `cd ..\path\to\something` 
2. The `..` will have spacing issues with the **cd** depending on where the cursor is.

![issue](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6662208/23109356/2cb70694-f6de-11e6-86c4-87a64f99d815.gif)

data.title: Fix #20897
data.body:
Test if git username and password are entered before pushing commit
Issue: https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/20897

data.title: Add negated inDebugMode context to fullscreen keybinding
Test if git username and password are entered before pushing commit
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->
Currently using the git integration UI, git tries to push commits before testing if a password was entered. A test should be carried to make sure both fields have been entered before form submission. 

- VSCode Version: 1.9.1
- OS Version: Ubuntu 16.04 LTS  

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Clone a repository eg. `git clone https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode.git`
2. Make changes, then try to push via the `git` tab in the left bar
3. Enter GitHub username
4. Leave `password` field blank
5. Click OK button.
6. Form should submit, but fail to push commits because password field was empty

data.title: Use official solarized themes
data.body:
Fixes #20873 

---

This change sources the solarized themes from the official, newer https://github.com/deplorableword/textmate-solarized repository, rather than from https://github.com/Colorsublime/Colorsublime-Themes

The official themes looks a lot better in general, with a notable regression I found being that it doesn't color types which was added in 5926ba029f433ff515454d8b92b7ecb2b3e6ea4e. We should probably work instead to upstream that and if it's not accepted due to inactivity, fork the repo so we can easily track the changes.

Comparisons (left old, right new):

XML

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2193314/23107861/a941285e-f6b9-11e6-9c19-32f2f7f51c17.png)

CSS

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2193314/23107867/b63570c4-f6b9-11e6-89f0-d6020ec9d8a3.png)

TS

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2193314/23107872/cbe6f582-f6b9-11e6-8edf-bc9c24aae873.png)
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2193314/23107874/dba82aea-f6b9-11e6-8e7f-4d1f40335b52.png)

Bash

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2193314/23107880/f6eba8b8-f6b9-11e6-89b9-f6cd84ec2ffe.png)

Python

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2193314/23107920/28e08a32-f6ba-11e6-89b3-9159ab8e21c2.png)

Ruby

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2193314/23107948/3d884d4e-f6ba-11e6-924a-6335059a5283.png)

Java

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2193314/23107954/52ae2806-f6ba-11e6-90bf-74b95d1f2819.png)

data.title: Automate yum repository install

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/229

We would like the yum repository to get installed automatically when you install the .rpm package, when I tried to do this however I ran into problems with `rpm` being locked in the `post` script of the .rpm package. [Chrome manages to do this somehow](https://cs.chromium.org/chromium/src/chrome/installer/linux/common/rpm.include?sq=package:chromium&type=cs&q=rpm.include&l=1).

data.title: Code - Insiders Helper stealing 100% CPU (and doesn't go away when closing Code)

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: `1.10.0-insider` 50f8848e44029ffabf0727de49cd18ae4069b4fe
- OS Version: macOS Sierra `10.12.3 (16D32)`

I don't really have any steps to reproduce, but this has been happening more and more frequently.

Here is some output from the hung process
```
> ps aux | grep 4088
eric              4088  99.5  0.2  3323384  37980   ??  R     3:46AM  55:12.95 /Applications/Visual Studio Code - Insiders.app/Contents/Frameworks/Code - Insiders Helper.app/Contents/MacOS/Code - Insiders Helper /Applications/Visual Studio Code - Insiders.app/Contents/Resources/app/out/bootstrap --type=extensionHost
```

I should also note that when I closed Code, many `Code - Insiders Helper` process were left behind but they all were cleaned up as soon as I killed the one above.

data.title: Parameter types not colour-coded properly
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.9.1 (f9d0c687ff2ea7aabd85fb9a43129117c0ecf519, 2017-02-08T23:31:51.320Z)
- OS Version: Darwin x64 16.4.0
- Extensions:

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|code-gnu-global|austin|0.2.1|
|code-runner|formulahendry|0.6.10|
|cpptools|ms-vscode|0.10.1|
|vscode-icons|robertohuertasm|7.2.0|
|ayu|teabyii|0.2.1|
|debug|webfreak|0.17.0|

---

Steps to Reproduce:
In the following code snippet, all of the parameter types such as double, int, char, should colour-coded as a type.

```
double fn(double (*f)(double), double a, int b, char c) {
...
}
```

Instead, only the **double**s in the first parameter `(double (*f)(double))` are coloured differently.

data.title: All cursors should do the same thing when typing
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.9.1
- OS Version: MacOs Sierra 10.12.3

Steps to Reproduce:

Select text and hit one of the **"**  , **'** or **`**

data.title: redirect input from file
data.body: I'd love to have something like this http://stackoverflow.com/questions/32863807/visual-studio-code-redirect-input-on-debug without a workaround. That is, ability to redirect input from a given file, when debugging.
